_comment: Created by ianb on 04/10/2013 13:00:47 using v0.9
title: How have patients' perceptions on the amount of nurses available changed?
analysis_commentary: The distribution of responses to this question has remained broadly stable since 2005. Overall, in 2012, 59% of respondents felt there were enough nurses on duty to care for them in hospital, while 11% felt there were not enough nurses on duty, which equates to approximately 6, 977 patients.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients
